snippet: With 20 percent opting out this year, some statisticians say it is hard to determine whether students improved over all from last year.
abstract: Refusal of some 20 percent of students to take 2015 standardized tests in New York State has badly compromised data used by educational accountability movement to evaluate educational progress.
lead_paragraph: With 20 percent opting out this year, some statisticians say it is hard to determine whether students improved over all from last year.

headline.main: Test-Refusal Movement’s Success Hampers Analysis of New York State Exam Results
headline.print_headline: Test-Refusal Movement’s Success Hampers Analysis of Exam Results
